parameters: Sounds like some sort of beast.
Then we are in the right place.
Feel like we forgoting something, better went back and check.

Feel like we forgoting something, better went back and check.
A crystal... with a flower inside?
A crystal... with a flower inside?
A crystal... with a flower inside?
A peach blossom... but wait, shouldn’t it be a rose?
What token? Well I don't care.
But a peach blossom—now that catches my interest.
Once, I traveled to a far eastern realm.
A vast, wondrous land, brimming with culture so different from ours.
In their tradition, this flower symbolizes joyful love.
Well, let's break this and take it out.
I can feel it—the energy radiating from this flower.
It holds the power to enhance one's abilities.
But there’s a catch—it can only be worn by a female.\|
\P[1] you don't want a flower on you head, don't you?
Alice, why don’t you try it on? It will only enhance your beauty.
Alice, why don’t you try it on? It will only enhance your beauty.
Alice, why don’t you try it on? It will only enhance your beauty.
It’s as if the flower itself chose to polish your beauty and power.
Now we have deafeated the beast.\|
Let's go!!! New Lost boys... and girls!!!
Wait when did we joined the Lost boys... and girls?
What? Alice how could you speak that cold word from your mouth?
We are a team, and we will advanture together.
It's time for you to pay your debt—with your life!
Did you really think that was the Ritual of the Chess?
It was worth twisting it into that form to deceive you.
What do you mean by that?
Don't you even have a brain to think?
The Ritual of the Chess requires both players' present to function.
Is Adam even in this castle?\|
We've been the only living beings here this whole time.
Those were Adam's loyal soldiers—some of whom I corrupted.
They served as nails pinning our range of movement to this castle.
Now, without them, we'll be free!
We can finally carve out a story of our own.
Not as mere appendages to someone else’s tale.
You won't go anywhere until you've paid for your sins—with your life!
It seems someone wishes to block our path.\.
I don't mind a little snack before we leave, do you, my dear?
They will make a fine feast for the start of our journey.
But a loss is a loss.\| There's no denying it.
Has it ended before it even began?
What a tragic conclusion to our story...
Take your rightful glory and the victory you've earned.
But before you end us, may I ask a question.\|
How many chess piece have you collected along the way?
So, you've managed to gather all 12 chess pieces...\|
Very well, I suppose you've earned the truth.
This story... our story... began with Adam, the cursed prince
But our existence—Bella’s and mine—was no mere accident.
My love... why must you tell them?
My love... must we burden them with this?
No, Bella.\| They deserve to know.\.
They deserve to understand the price of our sins.\|
And... I don't want the other me to get away with no cost.
After Bella broke Adam’s curse, peace returned to the castle.
\.For a time, it seemed as though happiness might endure.\|
But it didn’t last. The servants—those who had cared for him his entire
One by one, they vanished without a trace.\. Adam was desperate.\|
He sought out the witch who had first cursed him, hoping she might
Her words were a dagger to his heart.\|
"Your story has ended," she told him.
"And when a story ends, all within it begins to fade."\|
Adam couldn’t accept it. He couldn’t bear the thought of losing the castle,
So, in his desperation, he devised a reckless, horrifying plan.
He believed that by becoming a concept—an eternal villain—he could
tether the story to existence forever.\.
He turned to the same ritual that once cursed him, believing it would
grant him the strength to defy fate.\|
But this time... something went terribly wrong.
The curse did not simply grant him the power of the beast.\|
It fractured his very soul, creating me—an independent consciousness.\|
And the curse did not stop with him. It consumed Bella, too.\|
We are just pity vile creature from the darkest side of their soul.
Adam... Adam has never stopped chasing his goal.\|
He locked us in this castle, summoning adventurers to kill
But now... the spell is broken. \.
The chess pieces you hold have shattered his control.\|
And yet, we can only beg one thing of you.\|
Please, do not return the pieces to him.\|
If Adam completes his plan, he will forge a kingdom of darkness—a
We don't expect your mercy, we deserve this death for our sin.
But so does Adam, he shouldn't get away with no cost.
Well at least, we die together.
For the end of monsters, it's not bad after all.
...\. Well, it make sense to not trust a monster.
\|Atleast, I'm not dying alone, I have you- my dear.
You shall serve as our first meal for freedom.
There is a tale that has traveled across time,
whispered from one generation to the next.
It speaks of a pair of monsters who roamed the world,
They would grant gold to people,
only to watch as greed consumed them and tore their lives apart.
No one knew where the monsters came from,
and no one could guess where they were headed.
They were a mystery, a curse, and a challenge all at once.
Until, one fateful day, a champion rose.
it is said, they struck down the monsters,
Yet, others tell a different version of the story—a quieter,
They say those so-called champions were none other than the monsters themselves.
Tired of their mischief and destruction,
the pair chose to lay down their immortal burdens and vanish,
No one knows the truth. Perhaps no one ever will.
Yet their story lives on, an echo carried by the winds,
shared in whispers and songs, destined to linger in
the hearts of those who hear it.
It's time for you to pay your debt—with your life!
Did you really think that was the Ritual of the Chess?
It was worth twisting it into that form to deceive you.
What do you mean by that?
Don't you even have a brain to think?
The Ritual of the Chess requires both players' present to function.

There is a tale that has traveled across time,
whispered from one generation to the next.
It speaks of a pair of monsters who roamed the world,
They would grant gold to people,
only to watch as greed consumed them and tore their lives apart.
No one knew where the monsters came from,
and no one could guess where they were headed.
They were a mystery, a curse, and a challenge all at once.
Until, one fateful day, a champion rose.
it is said, they struck down the monsters,
Yet, others tell a different version of the story—a quieter,
They say those so-called champions were none other than the monsters themselves.
Tired of their mischief and destruction,
the pair chose to lay down their immortal burdens and vanish,
No one knows the truth. Perhaps no one ever will.
Yet their story lives on, an echo carried by the winds,
shared in whispers and songs, destined to linger in
the hearts of those who hear it.
